result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:55 p.m.
State appears by ADA D. Toldt; Defendant appears in person with Atty John Bliss.
DATE AND TIME SET FOR MOTION TO REVOKE DEJ.

State recites History and notes that defendant has NOT complied with all terms and conditions of deferred entry agreement.
Def Makes Argument. 
Atty Bliss makes Motion to Withdraw of Counsel and will submit written request to the COURT.
COURT extends DEJ for 1 year.
Review Date: 02/09/2017 @ 1:10 p.m. with BR 2 JA.

ADJ: 2:09 p.m.
to Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgmentof Count One - stj
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Becky.
Case called: 9:11 am
State appears by ADA D Toldt.  Def appears with Atty John Bliss.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed; Written DEJ agreement filed;
State moves to:
Ct 2 (DC)>D&RI
COURT GRANTS
PLEA:
Ct 1 (Resisiting an Officer)>NO CONTEST
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis;
COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.
COURT defers matter for a period of 12 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to DISMISS Ct. 1;

Bond continues.
DEJ RH> 11/17/2016 @ 1:10 pm
Adj: 9:23 am
